h1002.definition: of foreign origin; a castle or palace; palace.

h1004.definition: probably from {{h1129}} abbreviated; a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.); court, daughter, door, + dungeon, family, + forth of, × great as would contain, hangings, home(born), (winter) house(-hold), inside(-ward), palace, place, + prison, + steward, + tablet, temple, web, + within(-out).

h1006.definition: the same as {{h1004}}; Bajith, a place in Palestine; Bajith.

h1007.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h205}}; house of vanity; Beth-Aven, a place in Palestine; Beth-aven.

h1008.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h410}}; house of God; Beth-El, a place in Palestine; Beth-el.

h1009.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h695}} and {{h410}}; house of God's ambush; Beth-Arbel, a place in Palestine; Beth-Arbel.

h1010.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h1168}} and {{h4583}}; house of Baal of (the) habitation of (apparently by transposition); or (shorter) בֵּית מְעוֹןlemma בֵּית מעוֹן missing vowel, corrected to בֵּית מְעוֹן; house of habitation of (Baal); Beth-Baal-Meon, a place in Palestine; Beth-baal-meon. Compare {{h1186}} and {{h1194}}.

h1011.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h1254}}; house of a creative one; Beth-Biri, a place in Palestine; Bethbirei.

h1012.definition: probably from {{h1004}} and {{h5679}}; house of (the) ford; Beth-Barah, a place in Palestine; Beth-barah.

h1013.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h1447}}; house of (the) wall; Beth-Gader, a place in Palestine; Beth-gader.

h1014.definition: from {{h1004}} and the passive participle of {{h1576}}; house of (the) weaned; Beth-Gamul, a place East of the Jordan; Beth-gamul.

h1015.definition: from {{h1004}} and the dual of {{h1690}}; house of (the) two figcakes; Beth-Diblathajim, a place East of the Jordan; Beth-diblathaim.

h1016.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h1712}}; house of Dagon; Beth-Dagon, the name of two places in Palestine; Beth-dagon.

h1017.definition: patrial from {{h1008}} with the article interposed; a Beth-elite, or inhabitant of Bethel; Bethelite.

h1018.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h681}} with the article interposed; house of the side; Beth-ha-Etsel, a place in Palestine; Beth-ezel.

h1019.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h1537}} with the article interposed; house of Gilgal (or rolling); Beth-hag-Gilgal, a place in Palestine; Beth-gilgal.

h1020.definition: from {{h1004}} and the plural of {{h3451}} with the article interposed; house of the deserts; Beth-ha-Jeshimoth, a town East of the Jordan; Beth-jeshimoth.

h1021.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h3754}} with the article interposed; house of the vineyard; Beth-hak-Kerem, a place in Palestine; Beth-haccerem.

h1022.definition: patrial from {{h1035}} with the article inserted; a Beth-lechemite, or native of Bethlechem; Bethlehemite.

h1023.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h4801}} with the article interposed; house of the breadth; Beth-ham-Merchak, a place in Palestine; place that was far off.

h1024.definition: or (shortened) בֵּית מַרְכָּבוֹת; from {{h1004}} and the plural of {{h4818}} (with or without the article interposed); place of (the) chariots; Beth-ham-Markaboth or Beth-Markaboth, a place in Palestine; Bethmarcaboth.

h1025.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h6010}} with the article interposed; house of the valley; Beth-ha-Emek, a place in Palestine; Beth-emek.

h1026.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h6160}} with the article interposed; house of the Desert; Beth-ha-Arabah, a place in Palestine; Beth-arabah.

h1027.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h7311}} with the article interposed; house of the height; Beth-ha-Ram, a place East of the Jordan; Beth-aram.

h1028.definition: probably for {{h1027}}; Beth-ha-Ran, a place East of the Jordan; Beth-haran.

h1029.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h7848}} with the article interposed; house of the acacia; Beth-hash-Shittah, a place in Palestine; Beth-shittah.

h1030.definition: patrial from {{h1053}} with the article inserted; a Beth-shimshite, or inhabitant of Bethshemesh; Bethshemite.

h1031.definition: from {{h1004}} and the same as {{h2295}}; house of a partridge; Beth-Choglah, a place in Palestine; Beth-hoglah.

h1032.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h2356}}; house of hollowness; Beth-Choron, the name of two adjoining places in Palestine; Beth-horon.

h1033.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h3733}}; house of pasture; Beth-Car, a place in Palestine; Beth-car.

h1034.definition: from {{h1004}} and the plural of {{h3833}}; house of lionesses; Beth-Lebaoth, a place in Palestine; Beth-lebaoth. Compare {{h3822}}.

h1035.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h3899}}; house of bread; Beth-Lechem, a place in Palestine; Bethlehem.

h1036.definition: from {{h1004}} and the feminine of {{h6083}} (with preposition interposed); house to (i.e. of) dust; Beth-le-Aphrah, a place in Palestine; house of Aphrah.

h1037.definition: or בֵּית מִלֹּא; from {{h1004}} and {{h4407}}; house of (the) rampart; Beth-Millo, the name of two citadels; house of Millo.

h1038.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h4601}}; house of Maakah; Beth-Maakah, a place in Palestine; Beth-maachah.

h1039.definition: from {{h1004}} and the feminine of {{h5246}}; house of (the) leopard; Beth-Nimrah, a place east of the Jordan; Beth-Nimrah. Compare {{h5247}}.

h1040.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h5730}}; house of pleasure; Beth-Eden, a place in Syria; Beth-eden.

h1041.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h5820}}; house of Azmaveth, a place in Palestine; Bethaz-maveth. Compare {{h5820}}.

h1042.definition: from {{h1004}} and a plural from {{h6030}}; house of replies; Beth-Anoth, a place in Palestine; Beth-anoth.

h1043.definition: an orthographical variation for {{h1042}}; Beth-Anath, a place in Palestine; Beth-anath.

h1044.definition: from {{h1004}} and a derivative of {{h6123}}; house of (the) binding (for sheep-shearing); Beth-Eked, a place in Palestine; shearing house.

h1045.definition: ; from {{h1004}} and {{h6252}}; house of Ashtoreths; Beth-Ashtaroth, a place in Palestine; house of Ashtaroth. Compare {{h1203}}, {{h6252}}.

h1046.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h6412}}; house of escape; Beth-Palet, a place in Palestine; Beth-palet.

h1047.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h6465}}; house of Peor; Beth-Peor, a place East of the Jordan; Bethpeor.

h1048.definition: from {{h1004}} and a derivative from {{h6327}}; house of dispersion; Beth-Patstsets, a place in Palestine; Beth-pazzez.

h1049.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h6697}}; house of (the) rock; Beth-Tsur, a place in Palestine; Beth-zur.

h1050.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h7339}}; house of (the) street; Beth-Rechob, a place in Palestine; Beth-rehob.

h1051.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h7497}}; house of (the) giant; Beth-Rapha, an Israelite; Beth-rapha.

h1052.definition: or בֵּית שָׁן; from {{h1004}} and {{h7599}}; house of ease; Beth-Shean or Beth-Shan, a place in Palestine; Beth-shean, Beth-Shan.

h1053.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h8121}}; house of (the) sun; Beth-Shemesh, a place in Palestine; Beth-shemesh.

h1054.definition: from {{h1004}} and {{h8598}}; house of (the) apple; Beth-Tappuach, a place in Palestine; Beth-tappuah.

h1055.definition: probably from {{h1004}}; a palace (i.e. large house); palace.

h1056.definition: from {{h1058}}, weeping; Baca, a valley in Palestine; Baca.

h1057.definition: the same as {{h1056}}; the weeping tree (some gum-distilling tree, perhaps the balsam); mulberry tree.

h1058.definition: a primitive root; to weep; generally to bemoan; × at all, bewail, complain, make lamentation, × more, mourn, × sore, × with tears, weep.

h1060.definition: from {{h1069}}; first-born; hence, chief; eldest (son), firstborn(-ling).

h1061.definition: from {{h1069}}; the first-fruits of the crop; first fruit (-ripe (figuratively)), hasty fruit.

h1062.definition: or (short) בְּכֹרָה; feminine of {{h1060}}; the firstling of man or beast; abstractly primogeniture; birthright, firstborn(-ling).

h1063.definition: feminine of {{h1061}}; the early fig; firstripe (fruit).

h1064.definition: feminine of {{h1062}}; primogeniture; Bekorath, an Israelite; Bechorath.

h1065.definition: from {{h1058}}; a weeping; by analogy, a dripping; overflowing, × sore, (continual) weeping, wept.

h1066.definition: plural active participle of {{h1058}}; (with the article) the weepers; Bo-kim, a place in Palestine; Bochim.

h1067.definition: feminine from {{h1069}}; the eldest daughter; firstborn.

h1069.definition: a primitive root; properly, to burst the womb, i.e. (causatively) bear or make early fruit (of woman or tree); also (as denominative from {{h1061}}); to give the birthright; make firstborn, be firstling, bring forth first child (new fruit).

h1070.definition: from {{h1069}} (in the sense of youth); a young camel; dromedary.

h1071.definition: the same as {{h1070}}; Beker, the name of two Israelites; Becher.

h1072.definition: feminine of {{h1070}}; a young she-camel; dromedary.

h1073.definition: by orthographical variation for {{h1063}}; a first-ripe fig; first-ripe.

h1074.definition: from {{h1069}}; first-born; Bokeru, an Israelite; Bocheru.

h1075.definition: from {{h1069}}; youth-ful; Bikri, an Israelite; Bichri.

h1076.definition: patronymically from {{h1071}}; a Bakrite (collectively) or descendants of Beker; Bachrites.

h1077.definition: from {{h1086}}; properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest; lest, neither, no, none (that...), not (any), nothing.

h1078.definition: by contraction for {{h1168}}; Bel, the Baal of the Babylonians; Bel.

h1079.definition: (Aramaic) from {{h1080}}; properly, anxiety, i.e. (by implication) the heart (as its seat); heart.

h1080.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1086}} (but used only in a mental sense); to afflict; wear out.

h1081.definition: from {{h1078}} and {{h113}} (contracted); Bel (is his) lord; Baladan, the name of a Babylonian prince; Baladan.

h1082.definition: a primitive root; to break off or loose (in a favorable or unfavorable sense), i.e. desist (from grief) or invade (with destruction); comfort, (recover) strength(-en).

h1083.definition: from {{h1082}}; desistance; Bilgah, the name of two Israelites; Bilgah.

h1084.definition: from {{h1082}}; desistant; Bilgai, an Israelite; Bilgai.

h1085.definition: of uncertain derivation; Bildad, one of Job's friends; Bildad.

h1086.definition: a primitive root; to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend); consume, enjoy long, become (make, wax) old, spend, waste.

h1088.definition: feminine of {{h1087}}; failure; Balah, a place in Palestine; Balah.

h1089.definition: a primitive root (rather by transposition for {{h926}}); to palpitate; hence, (causatively) to terrify; trouble.

h1090.definition: from {{h1089}}; timid; Bilhah, the name of one of Jacob's concubines; also of a place in Palestine; Bilhah.

h1091.definition: from {{h1089}}; alarm; hence, destruction; terror, trouble.

h1092.definition: from {{h1089}}; timid; Bilhan, the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite; Bilhan.

h1093.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h1086}}; excise (on articles consumed); tribute.

h1094.definition: or (fully) בְּלוֹי; from {{h1086}}; (only in plural construction) rags; old.

h1095.definition: of foreign derivation; Belteshatstsar, the Babylonian name of Daniel; Belteshazzar.

h1097.definition: from {{h1086}}; properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.; corruption, ig(norantly), for lack of, where no...is, so that no, none, not, un(awares), without.

h1098.definition: from {{h1101}}; mixed, i.e. (specifically) feed (for cattle); corn, fodder, provender.

h1099.definition: from {{h1097}} and {{h4100}}; (as indefinitely) nothing whatever; nothing.

h1100.definition: from {{h1097}} and {{h3276}};(often in connection with {{h376}}, {{h802}}, {{h1121}}, etc.); without profit, worthlessness; by extension, destruction, wickedness; Belial, evil, naughty, ungodly (men), wicked.
